content.description: Thin, reachy, face moves predominate throughout this route.
content.protection: Not much.  TR, or don't fall.
content.location: Go straight up at far right of wall just before overhang; follow small holds to the top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Decent sustained route. Small holds in between large horizontal cracks.
content.location: Start left of Anna's route and climb straight up below roofs. Head right around the small roofs to a mantle top out.

content.description:
Claimed to be "the hardest 10 at Peterskill." Sustained, challenging climb with a variety of moves. Manages to feel pumpy and crimpy.

 Two specific cruxes, moving right from near the piton grabbing a small pinch with what feel like a loose rock in it. Then traversing back left, finding the crack again and laying out to the left.
content.location:
About 20 feet from the left of the rock, follow a crack moving up and left. Starts in front of two trees growing close together.

 Or look for an old piton sticking out about 15 feet off the ground.

content.description:
Climb straight up to the triangular prow of rock.

 A few tricky/reachy moves including a difficult crux close to the ground.

 This section of the rock is often quite dirty/mossy.
content.protection: Usually top-roped, could be led with micro-cams.
content.location:
Start just to the right of the yellow ropes marking the far end of climbable territory at Peterskill, just in front of a tree and to the right of the dark mossy face.

 Alternately, just under the notable triangular prow of rock sticking out towards the top.

content.description: A good route for beginners, it has a rather scary crux nonetheless.
content.protection: Adequate, but probably not for a 5.3 leader.
content.location: Climb right arete next to giant roof, step across gap (crux), scramble up easier rock to top.

content.description: Very easy route, good for beginners.  Also a good first lead.  All-gear anchor.
content.location: Climb obvious crack to right of Jumbled Arete.  Easy walk-off.
Start at letter box 8 feet left of Sound Barrier, follow seam, tending right to open book at top.

content.description: Sheltered from sun and wind, with a large overhang to protect against sudden rain.  A few easy routes, with a couple harder routes thrown in.
